alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 13 at 11:29PM PST until December 14 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Dangerous Winter Storm to Produce Very Heavy Snow with Strong Winds and Whiteout Conditions... .A strong winter storm continues to bring very heavy snow to the mountains of northern California. Moderate to heavy snow showers will continue into Tuesday. Snow levels will gradually lower over time through late tonight and Tuesday and into the Sierra Foothills. Expect tremendous snow accumulation at pass levels with yardsticks required for snow measurement. This will result in significant travel delays with extremely difficult to impossible travel over the mountains. Strong winds will further reduce visibilities during this event with whiteout conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches, with localized amounts up to 8 inches, are expected. * WHERE...Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley and Motherlode. * WHEN...Until 6 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
